title: Emma Thomas (rugby union)
text:
Emma Thomas (b. November 6, 1958) is a former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. She represented <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a> and <a href="Bay%20of%20Plenty%20Rugby%20Union">Bay of Plenty</a>. She made her international debut on 31 August, 1996 against <a href="Australia%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a> at <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>. She competed at the <a href="1998%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">1998 Women's Rugby World Cup</a>.
Thomas made her last appearance for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Black Ferns</a> in 1998.
